MICHAEL BESSASPARIS
Michael.Bessasparis@Gmail.com • 717-456-0439 • Kansas City, MO 64153
LinkedIn: www.linkedin.com/in/michaelbessasparis

INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY MANAGEMENT
Information technology professional.  Broadly experienced leader with a proven record of helping people use technology achieve their goals.  

Adaptability - Teamwork - Initiative - Selfless Service - Problem Solving - Budget Management

EDUCATION
    - Master of Science in Computer Science, Virginia Polytechnic University, Blacksburg, VA
    - Bachelor of Science in Computer Science, University of Pittsburgh, Pittsburgh, PA

TECHNICAL SKILLS
    - Microsoft Office: Outlook, PowerPoint, Word, Excel, Access; OneNote, SharePoint, Blackboard
    - Microsoft Windows, Linux, Android development, data and audio-video networking
    - COMPTIA Security+
    - Department of Defense Information Security Level II certified
    
PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCE
Deputy Chief Information Officer, U.S. Army, Fort Leavenworth, KS                        05/2014 - present
Provide direct support to the CIO of a 15,000 person organization with seven regional divisions.  Recommend changes to structure and processes.  Provide on-site customer support of 60 Windows computers, 15 printers, and an executive conference room with presentation and video-teleconference systems.
- Supervised final preparations for company's cyber security inspection.  Company received an "Excellent" grade.
- Planned and oversaw installation of classroom technology infrastructure consisting of 64 Windows computers, eight Smartboards, and VTC systems in four classrooms with internet access within three weeks ensuring new professional development program start dates were met.
- Developed the prototype of the U.S. Army's smart phone app enabling greater access to manuals by Soldiers.
- Implemented a project status review meeting improving CIO understanding of project status.

Operations Manager, U.S. Army, Kaiserslautern, Germany                                        06/2011 – 04/2014
Led a staff of seven personnel analyzing customer requirements, assigning tasks to business groups for completion, and tracking status of logistics operations.  
- Led a six person team developing and briefing a plan synchronizing movement of 700 Soldiers and associated equipment to remote international locations.  Commended by the Chief Operating Officer.
- Developed a SharePoint page to track movement requests during government shutdown.  Provided shared visibility of executing, planned, and delayed movements.
- Developed, implemented, and instructed team on use of new SharePoint processes improving team's ability to track tasks.

Director of Information Systems, U.S. Army, Carlisle, PA                                         06/2008 – 06/2011
Led a staff of 28 personnel and managed an operating budget of $200,000 providing customer support, information technology planning, and project management supporting a simulations center of 50 full time staff, 150 conferences, and 350 workstations.
- Planned and managed a $700,000 project reducing maintenance costs while improving the organization's ability to meet customers' needs.  Installed state-of-the-art high-definition cameras, audio-video matrix switchers, and control systems in three conference rooms and modernized the video operations center.
- Established an acquisition plan to maintain a modern simulations network. Leveraged unprogrammed funds to execute plan two years ahead of schedule.

Director of Logistics Information Systems, U.S. Army, Baghdad, Iraq                    03/2006 – 03/2007
Served as senior logistics information technology manager.  Managed $7.7 million of support contracts for 40 personnel maintaining desktop logistics systems, remote sensors, and satellite terminals.
- Achieved a 96% operational readiness rate of radio-frequency identification tracking systems providing logistics managers increased visibility of supplies and vehicles.
- Created online collaboration network for logistics professionals in Iraq. Adopted by logisticians growing from initial small group to 590 specialists Army-wide
- Supervised the fielding of 3,800 trucking fleet tracking devices providing dispatchers with real-time visibility of distribution assets and increasing the safety of drivers.

Deputy Director of Educational Technology, U.S. Army, Leavenworth, KS             05/2002 – 05/2008
Served as a distance learning course developer for the Army's Graduate level college of 1,500 students, staff, and faculty.  Promoted to deputy director managing $1.7 million operating budget and 39 personnel.  Oversaw all information technology operations and customer support for VTCs, SmartBoards, Windows computers, and audio-video systems in 96 classrooms, two large auditoriums, and two executive conference rooms.
- Supervised information systems relocation into newly built hi-tech facility meeting all organization timelines.
- Fielded the college's first SharePoint, Blackboard, and Adobe Connect systems.  
- Implemented streaming media system for the college; increased education audience 10% by enabling remote campuses to participate in guest speaker lectures.
- Improved the college’s introductory course by creating internet lessons providing students easier access to material.

PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT
Diploma, Command and General Staff College, U.S. Army, Fort Leavenworth, KS
Certificate, Contract Management Course,  U.S. Army, Fort Belvoir, VA
Diploma, Signal Officer Advanced Course / Signal Officer Basic Course,  U.S. Army, Fort Gordon, GA

AWARDS
Defense Meritorious Service Medal, Army Meritorious Service Medal, Army Superior Unit Award, Bronze Order of Mercury Medal, Parachutist's Badge

VOLUNTEER EXPERIENCE
College Algebra Tutor, Boy Scout Leader
